title: Quick support question: problems with alt+tab
body:
Riot support:

Windows 10
Version 7.10
GeForce GTX 950M

This hasn't been an issue before, but in my previous two games alt+tabbing out of the window resulted in me not being able to open the window again. The first time I was in a game and the issue resolved when I ended the process and reconnected. The second time, however, it was during the loading screen and I was not able to reconnect, resulting in my dodging the game.

This does not seem to happen every time--I had tabbed out of the first game several times before I could not tab back in. 

Any help or advice would be appreciated. Let me know if you need any more information on my end.

replies.body: Alt+tabbing on those loading screens can sometimes interrupt the loading process, which is when you see it crash and can't alt+tab back into the game. My best suggestion to stop that from happening is to let the game fully load before switching out of it.
That's fine, but what about the same thing happening IN game? Any idea?

If it's happening during matches, my first suggestion would be to try running in windowed mode by hitting alt+enter. It's not the best solution I know, but that should let you alt+tab without interrupting the game's processes.

I'll try that for now.

It just happened again, BTW.

I have a question, why does League prevent alt tabbing during the initial loading of the loading screen?

It's like the only game that does this, I can immediately alt tab out of any other game, but NOT League

> Alt+tabbing on those loading screens can sometimes interrupt the loading process, which is when you see it crash and can't alt+tab back into the game. My best suggestion to stop that from happening is to let the game fully load before switching out of it.

Or use Borderless Window mode.
